documents.document: @IxDAwards I vote for #nzvisagateway for the 2017 People's Choice Award! Vote at https://t.co/PiZQTHbdSa
@LoveMySwitches Hi, just wondering when you're expecting to get more budget mono 1/4 inch jacks in stock?
@catalinbread My condolences, my heart goes out to you all :(
@NZTAWgtn proper honest to goodness traffic jam SH1 between Plimmerton and Pukerua bay
I am convinced that locked away somewhere is a portrait of Keith Richards that keeps getting younger and increasingly handsome.
@vodafoneNZ Thanks, all sorted :)
@vodafoneNZ thanks very much, just messaged
@vodafoneNZ Uh, just got a bill for $440 worth of additional data usage when we're on unlimited...is this a common issue?
@retrostrobe What's for lunch?
Listening to teens talk on the train is like hearing people reading out a list of Seinfeld jokes, trying to pass them off as their own.
I wanted to check the temperature of the room so what did I do? That's right, I used the kitchen scales! #notcomplainingbutwhyisthatthere?
@Zomato, you paid good money for your mobile site, just let me use it - I don't want/need your app!
@MaccasNZ It was the Paraparaumu McD's
@MaccasNZ Calamity! Tonight my Big Mac had only one patty. I ate it because it was delicious but I wistfully wonder at what might have been.
I bought some shoes from a drug dealer. I don't know what he laced them with, but I've been tripping all day.
@vodafoneNZ So Chorus raised wholesale prices on copper-served internet...why am I paying more for my internet on your coax cable network?
Had a dream that I bought a Neumann u87 for $81 and then people kept trying to steal it off me. I found it to be an oddly specific dream.
The new TV On The Radio album is really solid. Definitely worth a hoon if you're into that sort of thing.
What's happening to me? I'm listening to 80's super-shredtastic spandex poodle music played by Miss Piggy herself
@parndt It's true, he's pretty great. Only now am I appreciating his prodigious dadjoking power
Turns out I'm turning into my dad faster than I realised
We are fam-i-ly, I've got all these blisters on me
Eh checked the cupberd, eh checked the fridge; cen't find the butter, man.
There seems to be a direct correlation between my age and gherkin enjoyment. Coupled with "you are what you eat", I may end up as a Gherkin.
Put the Mars Volta on the office stereo - let's see how far through an album we can get
It's dadjoke time! Q: What do you call a Russian who accidentally does a shart? A: Hadimir Putin
@brehaut You know all my secrets. Bought a EGDM and I am excited, and I love acronyms.
@wilr @retrostrobe I think we should make the wall behind me a whisky bar, screw the infographic
@CampbellLiveNZ You gotta see this: https://t.co/ehSyDU0Ld4
The Slideshow on @TV3nz is the dumbest thing I've ever seen. Poor Cal Wilson, she's too good for this.
Suits is a show about being smug and handing each other folders, whilst trying to out-smug everyone else.
A bit risqué but still good: T: "I thought it would be bigger" J:"Haha, that's what your mum said! ...Wait...I did that wrong."
Got the receptionist to monitor my cup of tea & tell me when it was brewed. I ignored the call & let it hit voicemail because time is money.
I'm looking at the van in the mirror. I'm asking him to change his lane.
When it comes to eating, my daughter is a bottomless pit with a pitiless bottom.
@samseay Your day of understanding will come, and you be sad. And paranoid about smells.
Every time I wear this t-shirt it betrays me with its slow release smells, and yet I keep trusting it.
@samseay haha yeah, the cry-crap-consume-coma slug stage seems like it was years ago.
I can't believe my daughter is 1 year old?! Where did that go?
@keud12 down for me too
@IanGWV it's the equivalent of your computer crashing after you'd written a 3,000 word essay and were just about to hit the save button.
@IanGWV my computer died,
For those who don't relate to those previous feels, it is bad and I am sad.
Them feels where you get your meganav working, forget to commit, next morning compy has failed spectacularly & there's no recovery partition
Well, that's one to tick off the bucket list; drink some fine Whisky, wake up with no shoes?
Pretty sure I'll get one of these as a father's day gift some time in the future http://t.co/rh4JzMb9Wr
@designetica My one :) Also, hard to go past Sons & Co. at the moment
Good read http://t.co/0Uw0dKYNRj
http://t.co/jw3nwIH5H1 Interesting article about fat and stuff
My wife just said this: "Let's listen to something more relaxing, how about Black Sabbath?" I teared up a little.
@brehaut @pitchandtone @leapfrognz Yep, great to see it up huh.
Great stuff from Billy Corgan https://t.co/4BU6uYCO0T
@thebrittmann It smells off to me, at least at odds with Pliny the Younger's letter to Trajan. Misrepresents why Rome didn't like Xians imo
@AirNZFairy My wife, daughter & I are with family in Chch & loving it so much we wish we could go back to Welly on Sat instead of tomorrow!
@Jimtherocker Dr. Bier, I have not disappeared down the wah rabbit hole as yet, unfortunately. I've heard good things about the Clyde McCoy?
“@StephenAtHome: I knew there weren't any orcs in the audience tonight because Sting wasn't glowing blue.” Amazing.
Accidental Schadenfreude Anxiety: "like"-ing someones sad status then worrying they'll think you thought it was great something bad happened
@designetica I KNOW. I've had my iPhone 4 forever; it's time for newness and shinyness! (I had real consternation about the y in shinyness)
@rhettsnell ha! Love it
Officially down 10kg since Christmas today. Halfway there.
Oh great, I mention One Direction on Twitter, now all the spambots are attacking me. Look what you did Spotify, LOOK WHAT YOU DID
I wish Spotify actually bothered advertising something that suited my taste; why try sell me One Direction?
Anyone in Wellington have a room in their flat going spare? Got a workmate who's currently living out of luggage who really needs a place.
“@UberFacts: Exposing a man’s genitals to sunlight can cause his testosterone level to rise by 200%.” Those scots are on to something.
@guywilliamsguy Why can't you be plural? Then I could say you were In-Fidels and laugh like a Donkey at my own dadness.
Got a formica coffee table. Combined with our old lamps and imitation persian rugs, we can pretend it's 1989 in my parent's living room.
@hamo_d On this side of progeny arrival my enjoyment of daylight saving ending has severely diminished.
"We are therefore blessed with powerful minds yet at the same time cursed, not only to die, but to know that we must. …" - Stephen Cave
How to know what to read. http://t.co/Evqtf6J4Qu
After a tirade about how much I don't like Jazz & exactly why - "I feel that I my presence was inessential for that rant to take place."
@samseay "It says in gitblame that sam seay wrote the code 'Tony is the greatest' & then sprinkled infinite loops throughout our js."
Hypnopompic hallucinations can kiss my arse.
@samseay Re:profile picture, I should change it to the one on facebook, where people have used MSPaint to make me a pirate with a parrot.
Someone stole my credit card number! It cracks me up that they then tried to order $200 worth of takeaways and that's how they got caught.
Can't wait to have my ladies back home; all I've done is make a stew, a mess, & get sick with them away. Also, Oxford comma is the true way.
Been shut inside all day with flu, going to try & smack it around with a quiet curry and some firewater#i
Fun fact: Once I had bought some beers and had forgotten any sort of opener. Kristy opened them with her keyring & I immediately proposed.

I don't know where it's come from, but I feel that messages ending with a "." are much more serious.
E.g. hahaha
vs
hahaha.
Back in Christchurch, time to crack the Woodies and do some burnouts. Or get a latte. One of those things.
Ah geez, I'm on notice with @JoshBurt12 & @jwanne following me.
@russiancircband Are you guys going to make a flying visit to Wellington, NZ this year? It was so awesome last time!
The way these Russians are carrying on is simply Crimea-nal. They've no business Putin their soldiers there. It's a Vlad-y disgrace!
Neil Young: the best songs with the worst voice.
Good to sell the car. Hopefully the new one comes through!
Stuff Nation, the Woman's Day of NZ News sites.
@parndt I do, I'm just saying it's a passive process; water and soap go over them without my intervention.
Our legs are filthy; In the shower, we wash upper body, legs take of themselves. We wash T-Shirts daily, pants never.
That feel when you've got a seat on a full bus. I think it's guilt mixed with a warm rear end.
Just taking this moment to apologise to Moon, Entwistle, Daltrey, & Townsend for thinking 'Behind Blue Eyes" was a Limp Bizkit song at first
It looks like @SKYNZ 's SkyGo is locked down to the browser. Chrome had a tiny update, & now it's seen as a different device #overzealousDRM
@zollymonsta @TimShackleton @SKYNZ Away with thee troll! I can bitch and stitch as much as I like!
@SKYNZ Man, Skygo is terrible quality! I mean, yay I can watch it on an ipad, but this is terrible quality!
@benhurleycom Please become a commentator! Throw some Danny Morrisonism's in like "sweet bit of humpty" & "DLF Maximums" in next time
It's live! The biggie I've been working on for months! http://t.co/Z3Ayet5PYK
Have to hand it to @Jetstar_NZ, they fixed it up. No complaints here. Much obliged, Amanda.
Trying to show the OSX Mavericks installer who's boss. I won't stand for six hours of your schenanigans! I will end you.
@Jetstar_NZ Following now :)
Booking on @Jetstar_NZ, accidentally clicked the wrong sunday, went to change it on the web...$80 demanded. Calling up = $200?! Both absurd!
@Jenesyde Went straight to the toolbar, even.
@Jenesyde Rather glad the googling was done at home
